page.title: 10PEOPLE AND EVENTS
page.content: {Whitchurch was named}after its church, St.Alkmunds,called the white church, which collapsed and was rebuilt in 1711.{Whitchurch's most famous person is John Talbot,1st Earl of Shrewsbury, born in 1386.He fought many battles against the Welsh and French.He defeated Owen Glendower and took his wife and children prisoner.Sir John was killed by the French and his heart is in the porch of St.Alkmunds Church. Sir Edward German was also born here. {There was once a fine castle}at Castle Court,but now flats have been built on top of it.Some of the castle bricks have been used to line a bridge.When they were digging the foundations for Castle Court they discovered Roman coins and a Roman pot.Every year on November 11th there is a parade starting at the War Memorial at Queens Road which finishes at the church.
